message: hey guys just wanted feedback on a new app we made for shits and giggles, mostly giggles
any feedback or thoughts appreciated

OK I checked it out in it really does look like you spent more time on marketing than execution. My favorite groups are spammed, but I found nothing interesting yet on your site, not to mention it doesn't work on my Firefox.
@megatron nothing is spammed, it's probably just one of our friends dicking around
it took us (3 people) about 6 hours and some mashed up existing code and a database to get our MVP and then spent the next 18 hours marketing it on twitter/facebook/etc
http://wetcamp.us
@megatron are you talking about the "Go" button not working on firefox?
@alexbaldwin "Go" button, yes sir.
Its interesting, I guess its another site which relies on the twitter for content
Yah the go button doesn't work in firefox.

It sounds more like a porn site than a social site. I would feel almost.... awkward bringing  this up in conversation. Oh, and it seems that all the posts are just people trying to be clever about how many times they can mention a d*ck in a single sentence....
But hey, good luck to you. the concept of a drinking college social site has potential.
Just a heads up, but the current state of the front page has the N-word repeated all over it. :/
How can I change the campus?
I always wonder how these 24-hour projects end up looking so good
Did you use a blog/CSS theme?
hello
@hlfshell hahaha very true. yeah we tried to up the scandal factor
@whateverson yeah we don't filter anything. what you see is the most recent posts. sorry
@dhruvbird if you click on the logo to go back to the main page you can change the campus
@vfleurima nope it's not a theme, hand coded from less framework / blueprint css
@eightmotives none of our content comes from twitter

@vfleurima thanks though, there is only 2 screens so it's not too bad to make it good looking thanks to some pre-existing templates I made, colourlovers, and typekit :) let me know if you ever want some help

I know you're going for a pretty open approach, but you might want to implement some filtering on the content that shows up on your home page. Things like the n-word will only loose you users, and it might impact your pagerank when google will indexes it (that's pure speculation, though).

That said, I applaud you for going at it the right way. I've done plenty of 'develop it and they will come' projects, and they never work. It's always better to market it and then keep building if you see it's got potential.

...there's a caveat to that, though. The site needs to functional enough to be useful or fun; it has to make users want to come back. I'm not really sure how much stickiness there is to the site in it's current implementation.

@jskopek thanks for the feedback. we're using this as a tool to figure out viral loops and low interaction hurdles (the content is atrocious) I'll keep you guys updated on here, but so far we've doubled traffic every day for the last 3 days
If that's the case then where does the content come from?
@eightmotives a bunch of potty-mouthed college kids
@alexbaldwin the doubling traffic stat is pretty impressive for how little it took to code, have you continued your marketing actively in the last 3 days or has it just grown?
@alexbaldwin thanks for the offer! i suck at frontend stuff
@matwill nope, it just keeps growing!
@vfleurima no worries man, I'll try to get some templates up on github for you guys
